subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Cuckoo's Egg: Hunting a Spy Through Cyberspace
description: One-minute skill: The Cuckoo's Egg: Hunting a Spy Through Cyberspace.

hook.text: A 75-cent accounting error led an astronomer to uncover a KGB-funded hacking operation.

buildup.text: Cliff Stoll noticed a tiny billing discrepancy at Lawrence Berkeley Lab and traced it to an unauthorized user.

discovery.text: The hacker was Markus Hess, a German selling U.S. military secrets to the KGB through computer networks.

twist.text: No agency would help Stoll. He built his own monitoring system and honeypots to trap the spy.

climax.text: Stoll's persistence proved that cyber espionage was real â€” years before anyone took it seriously.

punchline.text: A 75-cent error exposed an international spy ring.

quiz.question: Who discovered the KGB-linked hacker Markus Hess?
